title: Initial Rescissions Of Harmful Executive Orders And Actions
tldr: Rescinds 78 Biden Administration executive orders and memoranda (~1/2 of Biden's EOs). Obviously too many to summarize.
status: Gives 1-2 months for departments to review and make sure that nothing here would cause the country to shut down or something.

title: Restoring Freedom Of Speech And Ending Federal Censorship
tldr: No federal employee should abridge free speech under the guise of combating misinformation. Also, make a report about whether it did that in the past.
status: Theoretically immediate but it's kind of hard to interpret what it means for most federal employees.

title: Ending The Weaponization Of The Federal Government
tldr: Reviews whether the previous administration weaponized the justice department and intelligence community against political opponents.
status: Justice department will probably get started on this pretty soon.

title: Return to In-Person Work
tldr: Return to In-Person Work for federal employees.
status: Might take a few months for departments to actually implement this. People have to be given time to relocate, etc.

title: Regulatory Freeze Pending Review
tldr: Freeze on any new rules from departments unless reviewed by new admin department heads.
status: Immediate. Likely will get retracted within a couple months though. Like a hiring freeze but for actions.

title: Hiring Freeze
tldr: Basically every admin does a hiring freeze. This one also instructs the OMB to make a plan to reduce the size of the workforce through 'efficiency improvements and attrition.'
status: Immediate. Will probably go on for several months.

title: Delivering Emergency Price Relief for American Families and Defeating the Cost-of-Living Crisis
tldr: Directs departments to make things cheaper for Americans.
status: Unclear.

title: Putting America First In International Environmental Agreements
tldr: Withdraws the US from the Paris Agreement.
status: Immediate

title: Granting Pardons And Commutation Of Sentences For Certain Offenses Relating To The Events At Or Near The United States Capitol On January 6, 2021
tldr: Pardons a lot of ppl, including Jan 6th convictions.
status: Immediate

title: Application Of Protecting Americans From Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act To TikTok
tldr: 75 day delay to TikTok ban.
status: Immediate (punts the issue down the line for 75 days)

title: Withdrawing The United States From The World Health Organization
tldr: Withdraws the US from the WHO.
status: Immediate, but disentangling from the WHO will take a bit of time.

title: Restoring Accountability To Policy-Influencing Positions Within the Federal Workforce
tldr: Makes it easier to fire federal employees in policy roles.
status: Already sued over this by a federal union.

title: Holding Former Government Officials Accountable For Election Interference And Improper Disclosure Of Sensitive Governmental Information
tldr: Revokes security clearance from a bunch of people.
status: Probably immediate. Some individuals might sue?

title: Declaring A National Emergency At The Southern Border Of The United States
tldr: Directs the military to prepare to assist at the southern border.
status: Secretary of Defense will get on this.

title: Memorandum to Resolve the Backlog of Security Clearances for Executive Office of the President Personnel
tldr: Expedites clearances for new appointees.
status: Immediate

title: America First Trade Policy
tldr: Lots and lots of trade directives: mostly investigating feasibility of various things like tariffs, resolving unfair trade practices by other countries, etc.
status: Will take some time for departments to do this. Some of these seem like they might face logistical challenges.

title: Clarifying The Militaryâ€™s Role In Protecting The Territorial Integrity Of The United States
tldr: Develop a plan to seal the borders.
status: Plan due within a month.

title: Unleashing American Energy
tldr: Removes regulatory barriers for energy production, mining, home appliances, and gas-powered vehicles. Restores LNG exports. Ends the Climate Corps, pauses IRA and Infrastructure Investment funds to green initiatives.
status: Much of this will likely take about a year to roll out, there's a lot of stuff in this EO that will take time.

title: Realigning the United States Refugee Admissions Program
tldr: Pauses all refugee admissions.
status: Immediate.

title: Protecting The Meaning And Value Of American Citizenship
tldr: Ends birthright citizenship.
status: Will be blocked this month (>90% on prediction markets). And odds are low that it will not be declared unconstitutional by the supreme court.

title: Securing Our Borders
tldr: Builds the wall, perhaps, ends CBP One, and adopts other policies aiming to secure the border.
status: Will take some time to roll out these changes.

title: Putting People Over Fish: Stopping Radical Environmentalism to Provide Water to Southern California
tldr: Memorandum about working to re-route water in Southern California.
status: Likely still subject to the previous lawsuit from the last administration.

title: Restoring The Death Penalty And Protecting Public Safety
tldr: Restores federal capital punishment.
status: Fairly immediate.

title: Promoting Beautiful Federal Civic Architecture
tldr: Retvrn to classical architecture.
status: Likely will run into logistical challenges given that construction is a long process and most buildings are planned a while in advance.

title: Restoring Accountability for Career Senior Executives
tldr: Gives greater executive control over career senior executive service workforce.
status: Fairly immediate.

title: Declaring a National Energy Emergency
tldr: Directs departments to urgently facilitate energy and natural resource project.
status: Will take a couple months for this to roll out. Likely will face lawsuits on many energy projects and resource extraction.

title: Reevaluating And Realigning United States Foreign Aid
tldr: Pause on disbursement of foreign aid, orders a review of foreign assistance programs to make them consistent with current US foreign policy.
status: Immediate pause, larger changes will roll out in coming months.

title: Organization of the National Security Council and Subcommittees
tldr: Reorg of the national security council.
status: Fairly immediate.

title: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Global Tax Deal (Global Tax Deal)
tldr: Withdraws US from the OECD Global Tax Deal.
status: Fairly immediate.

title: Declassification of Records Concerning the Assassinations of President John F. Kennedy, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and then Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, JR.
tldr: Declassifies records related to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, Senator Robert F. Kennedy, and then Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, JR.
status: in progress
